name: sugar
explanation: Sugar is not easily processed by a diabetic person's body. Too much sugar can cause high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) which can cause increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, nausea and vomiting, shortness of breath, stomach pain, fruity breath odor, a very dry mouth, rapid heartbeat, and diabetic coma.
suggestions: Sugar is important for bodily function, but sugar intake should be carefully monitored to avoid high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) and low blood sugar (hypoglycemia).

name: sport drinks
explanation: Sports drinks like Gatorade may be helpful for highly active, healthy people, but people with diabetes should steer clear—even if they hit the gym on the reg. They can be an unnecessary source of calories, added sugars, and sodium, which are all things people with diabetes should avoid.
suggestions: Stay hydrated during your workout with cold H2O—it really is your best bet.

name: nacho
explanation: Nachos are high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat.
suggestions: Use reduced-fat cheese and baked tortilla chips. Eat as a meal, not an appetizer.

name: coffee
explanation: Coffee drinks at places like Starbucks should be avoided as they are high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat. Coffee can be made in a healthier way, though.
suggestions: Try a cup of coffee with a little skim milk.

name: baked good
explanation: Baked goods are high in calories, carbohydrates, trans fat, and sugar.
suggestions: Some baked goods can be made healthier by using rolled oats, cornmeal, whole grain, or wheat flour.

name: battered fish
explanation: Battered fish is high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat. It has too much starch.

name: canned vegetables
explanation: Canned vegetables are generally okay but can be high in sodium.
suggestions: Opt for raw or frozen vegetables instead.

name: biscuit and gravy
explanation: Biscuits and gravy are high in calories, saturated fat, and sodium.

name: cereal
suggestions: Make sure it's made with whole grain and watch for added sugar.

name: chinese
explanation: Many Chinese dishes are deep-fried and contain rice. These are high in calories and carbohydrates.
suggestions: Avoid deep-fried entrees and rice. Dishes with no breading and a high vegetable proportion are okay.

name: corn
explanation: While corn is a vegetable, it is very starchy and high in carbohydrates.
suggestions: Try other vegetables besides corn and potatoes.

name: french fry
explanation: French fries are high in calories, saturated fat, and sodium.

name: fried chicken
explanation: Fried chicken is high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat.
suggestions: Try grilled chicken instead of fried.

name: frozen meal
explanation: Frozen meals are often high in fat and sodium. Pot pies are a huge offender.
suggestions: Meals cooked from scratch can be made much healthier than pre-packaged frozen meals.

name: fruit juice
explanation: Many packaged fruit juices are high in calories and sugar.
suggestions: Read the label. Be especially aware of service size. You can squeeze your own juice for a healthier option.

name: hamburger
explanation: Hamburgers are extremely high in saturated fat. Especially burgers from restaurants.
suggestions: At restaurants, try to find healthier options by looking at any nutritional information they offer.

name: lettuce
suggestions: Most lettuce is great for you. Perfer other types over iceberg, as it's low in nutrients.

name: lunch meat
explanation: Pre-packed lunch meat is high in sodium.
suggestions: Meat sliced at the deli department can be okay, but roasting and slicing your own meat at home with no added sodium is the best.

name: milkshake
explanation: Milkshakes are high in calories, trans fat, and sugar.

name: pickle
explanation: Most pickles are very high in sodium.

name: Pizza
explanation: Pizza is often high in calories, carbohydrates, fat, and sodium.
suggestions: If you must eat pizza, opt for vegetable toppings. Pay close attention to the nutritional content and the serving size.

name: potato
explanation: Potatoes are high in carbohydrates.
suggestions: Try other vegetables besides potatoes and corn.

name: processed grain
explanation: Processed grains are high in carbohydrates.
suggestions: Some items that are typically made with processed grains can be made healthier by using rolled oats, cornmeal, whole grain, or wheat flour.

name: sauerkraut
explanation: Sauerkraut is high in sodium.

name: smoothie
explanation: Many made to order smoothies and smoothie mixes contain hidden sugars.
suggestions: Make your own smoothies with fresh fruit and no added sugar.

name: Soda
explanation: Sode is very high in sugar.
suggestions: Try sparkling water with fruit. Diet soda can also be okay.

name: sweet potato
suggestions: Pay attention to serving size, added sugar, and added butter.

name: tortilla
suggestions: Tortillas made with whole grain are much healthier than with other processed grains.

name: vegetable
suggestions: Try vegetables raw, steamed, roasted, or grilled. Avoid added butter, cheese, or sauce.

name: whole grain
suggestions: Watch out for added sugar.

name: grilled chicken
suggestions: Grilled is much healthier than frying chicken.

name: sushi
explanation: Most sushi dishes contain a lot of short-grain sticky white rice, which is very high in carbohydrates and should be avoided.
suggestions: Try rolls made with quinoa, brown rice, lean proteins like fish, and healthy fats like avocado. Avoid deep-fried rolls. Opt for low-sodium soy sauce and watch out for added sugar.

name: taco bell
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Opt for a black bean burrito, soft chicken tacos, or a fresco grilled steak soft taco.

name: wendy
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Try a grilled chicken sandwich, power mediterranian chicken salad, or apple pecan chicken salad.

name: burger king
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: A basic burger with no mayonnaise or a salad are better options.

name: subway
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Opt for a 6 inch sandwich on honey oat or 9 grain bread, veggie delight, oven roasted/rotisserie chicken, or roast beef.

name: arby
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Try a classic roast beef or turkey gyro pita wrap.

name: mcdonald
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: A basic burger, side salad with baslamic dressing, apple slices, and unsweetened tea are some healtheir options.

name: kfc
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Opt for grilled or baked chicken and sweet kernel corn over other options.

name: chipotle
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Try a vegetarian or chicken bowl, crispy tacos with chicken, or brown rice.

name: chick fil a
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: A grilled chicken sandwich, small fruit cup, and unsweetened iced tea are healtheir options.

name: jimmy john
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Try the #1, Pepe un-wich style with no mayonnaise and thinny chips.

name: panera
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Opt for a you pick two with half-smoked turkey breast on honey wheat loaf with low-fat garden vegetable with pesto soup, and acai berry iced green tea.

name: popeye
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: The six-piece chicken tenders, regular green beans, and applesauce are healthier options.

name: qdoba
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Try a naked burrito, pulled pork, pinto beans, lettuce, fajita vegetables, and mango salsa.

name: starbuck
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Opt for a spinach and feta breakfast wrap. Black coffee is healthier than all of the sugary drinks they offer.

name: panda express
explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
suggestions: Broccoli beef (no rice) and veggie spring rolls are healthier options.

name: carrots
explanation: Carrots are full of water and vitamins are a very healthy options.They help with eyes and stomach issues.
suggestions: Apples and Carrots mix or soups with carrots in are very healthy.

name: lentil
explanation: Lentils are a high-protein, high-fiber member of the legume famiy. An excellent natural source of folate and manganese.

name: salmon
explanation: Salmon are good for diabetes people. It rich of omega-3-fatty-acids which help lower the blood fats.

name: egg-white
explanation: Egg whites are a highly rich source of protein and have extremely low sugar content.
suggestions: Boiled eggs whites are an excellent diet for a healthy breakfast.

name: biryani
explanation: Biryani is a rice dish and it often contains a lot of oil
suggestions: Avoid eating Biryani in restaurants. Prepare it at home with brown basmati rice and without any oil if possible. Have veggies along with it.

name: chia seeds
explanation: Chia seeds contain high amount of fiber and help maintain blood glucose levels.

name: beans
explanation: Beans are better for blood sugar regulation than many other starchy foods

name: whole eggs
explanation: Whole eggs are packed with nutrients including protein and healthy fat
suggestions: Fried in butter, boiled, poached, scrambled

name: bacon
explanation: Bacon contains protein and healthy animal fat
suggestions: Eat by itself, with eggs, or add into your fav low carb dish
